transportAdvice: Singapore has an excellent, air-conditioned metro (MRT) and bus network that covers virtually all tourist areas, making it easy and affordable to get around without a car. Taxis and ride-hailing vehicles are widely available, and many attractions in areas like the Marina Bay and Orchard Road districts are walkable.

weather.description: January falls within the northeast monsoon season, bringing frequent heavy showers and overcast skies, though heat remains constant.
Rain eases slightly compared to January, with more sunny spells, but humidity stays high and afternoon showers are still common.
Transitional month with warming temperatures, a mix of sunny periods and afternoon thunderstorms, and consistently high humidity.
One of the hotter months, with intense sunshine and frequent afternoon thunderstorms typical of the inter-monsoon period.
Hot and humid with regular afternoon thunderstorms; mornings are often bright before clouds build through the day.
The southwest monsoon begins, bringing slightly drier conditions than the year's start but still warm and humid throughout.
One of the drier months of the year with more consistent sunshine, though humidity remains high and brief showers still occur.
Similar to July, with relatively lower rainfall and plenty of sunshine, making it a popular time to visit despite the heat.
Rain begins to increase again as the inter-monsoon period approaches, with warm temperatures and frequent afternoon thunderstorms.
October marks the start of the wetter inter-monsoon period, with heavy and sometimes prolonged rainfall alongside persistent heat.
The northeast monsoon arrives, bringing some of the heaviest rainfall of the year; expect frequent downpours and overcast conditions.
December is among the wettest months, with persistent monsoon rains, though festive decorations and events make it a lively time to visit.
